data.title: Authentic and very reasonable
data.text:
I have been to this restaurant several times and have never experienced dirty conditions or bland inedible food as one reviewer had experienced.

Recently, the menus were changed and are now both in English & Spanish.  The decor features lots of colorful painted chairs with the restaurant's name.  There are booths and tables available and you can order Spanish food and/or pizza.  This would be good for a family with picky eaters.

My wife and I usually get the goat meat burrito.  This is a very large burrito that is very tasty and less than $6.  You will not be able to pick it up to eat, a knife and fork are required.  They also give you tortilla chips with salsa.  The salsa is hot and spicy but you can request other salsas as well.  They also have specialty drinks that are tasty.

Parking (which could be a problem in New Brunswick) is adequate as this restaurant has a parking lot adjacent to it that is shared with a laundromat and other business.

Sometimes a person will come by with items to sell.  Just say "no thank you" and they won't ask again.

data.title: -Ugh- Dirty, Gross and Bland Food
data.text:
So, I was driving by one day and it looked nice and authentic from the outside and thought, I'll come back some day wit the family.  We went tonight 2/26/2016.  

When we sat down I noticed the table looked like it had not been cleaned or wiped down in a while, I wiped it down, the waitress took a while but came around... Took our order and brought stale tortilla chips and some salsa with a hair in it.... I wish down one in my group would have said, let's bail on this now... No one did so I figured we wee goon g to give it a shot. Bad move. Food was dry disgusting and tasteless... I had chicken fajita, the chicken was like wood. Seriously like wood. The vegetables were awful and bland..my son had something that's had shrimp, wings and a flouta that was fried beyond being edible.  

I looked around and realized the people were all from the country of the restaurant, which is fine, but the whole place and people looked dirty. 

Go someplace else. This place is dirty and unclean with awful food.

data.title: Mostly tasty & filling & fun
data.text: The salsa that does with chips in the beginning is delicious and super super hot- Watch out! I though the place was weirdly comforting inside even the the decor is outrageous, and mostly everyone's food was delicious and very authentic Mexican with cojilla, etc. I ordered a Tlayuda which was actually sort of bland (I think I could have made it better, though, with some extra salsa) but still fun and even a tad healthy.

data.title: Bright decor, good food, accessible location
data.text:
The chairs and tables are brightly painted.  The server handed us 6 menus-- 3 in Spanish, 3 in English.  The web site is written in Spanish and gives a good idea of the decor.  

The food is good, prices are low.  This is a neighborhood spot in a small urban strip mall with a laundromat a few steps away.  It's near the North East Corridor train line. Warm service and genuine Mexican food instead of fancy decor.  

There are a couple of handicapped parking spots in  the lot and a curb ramp near the front door of the restaurant.

data.title: Great food.  Cheap.
data.text: The atmosphere is kind of cheesy, and you may doubt that something that calls itself a pizzeria AND Mexican restaurant can be authentic, but don't let that fool you.  The food is great--try the brisket tacos, the mini sopes, the chicken mole.  (I'm sure lots of other stuff is good, too, but I always end up going for the chicken mole.)  My son and husband love the burritos.  And it's all really inexpensive.  You can get an unbelievable lunch for two--more than you can eat--for under $20.

data.title: Totally Mexican Style!
data.text: I went with two of my friends late night to Costa Chica. Excellent and Familiar environment. Their food is fresh and delicious. We had a very good time. The restaurant counts with a typical decoration that make you feel in Mexico.
